Articles.Content:
Hey guys,

So I've been lately creating some super-rovers, but found the measly 22 m/s top speeds hardly super-rover material. So I thought I'd make a distinction between the regular wheels and the new ones by making a new wheel, but I have no idea how to edit the textures as the new 1.0 system uses .dds files to store the textures. So far the tutorials for changing these only apply to much older versions of KSP, which used different filetypes to store the textures.

Any help on how to edit textures with the new system?

~ thatBeatsguy

Edited May 23, 2015 by thatBeatsguy
Use a program like paint.net (I know that paint.net can edit .DDS files)

Oh.

Well, at least this time it's much much easier now (no need to deal with hex editors and such). Thanks a lot!
